_header: It is in harvest carts to clatter
_description: Aphoristic lines: a schoolboy’s exercises, with a Latin translation — five monorhyming lines

BLHar1002.Transcription:
Hit ys in heruyst cartes to claterpaddockes for to crowde þat
                    sitt by þe waterWho so fall in þo slyw fenne he fylith
                    his haterWho so may not se he stumble the ratherand he hathe a neuyll
                    wyfe he thryuythe þe later
BLHar1002.Editions:
Wright,  Cyril Ernest. 
             “Late Middle English Parerga in a School Collection.” 
             Review of English Studies
         n.s. 2 (1951): 114-20: 118.
